text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I'm Ann Reardon 
and I have been sent a great challenge by

Ali Sanchez ... she says 'I was wondering 
if you could make a Minecraft cake using

all the ingredients and only the ingredients 
that are listed in the game?' Well, challenge

accepted. Of course if you're looking for a 
Minecraft cake for a birthday party I already

have several of those videos just search for 'Ann 
Reardon and Minecraft cake' and you'll find them.

But for today's challenge we're trying to 
do it the way they do it in game 😁So in the

minecraft game itself if you're going to make 
a cake what you need is three buckets of milk,

two piles of sugar, one egg and three bunches 
of wheat and you get one very large cake!

Now a bucket or a pile is not the normal 
measurements you see on recipes of course ... in

my cookbook I put grams and ounces and cups but 
definitely not buckets and piles ... because

how big is a bucket and how big is a pile? Well to 
figure out how much of the ingredients we're going

to use, the only clues we've got is if we look 
in-game as to how they source those ingredients.

So first of all for the milk to get a bucket 
of milk you of course milk a cow. Now how much

milk you get from one cow depends on quite a few 
factors depending of course on the breed of the

cow how close it is since it's carved how often 
you milk it and the method you used to milk it

but in general if you're milking a cow at home by 
hand you're going to get around three and a half

liters there's quite a bit of variation there but 
let's say three and a half liters in one bucket

and we have three of those buckets of milk 
to use for our cake. Next we have two piles

of sugar now how big is a pile of sugar? Well in 
the game you get sugar from harvesting sugar cane

and on each block you can see there that there's 
eight sugar canes on it and you can expect to

get between 50 and 150 grams of sugar from each 
sugar cane depending on its size and its weight.

Now of course in the game they just put the sugar 
on the crafting table and you just get sugar in

real life you've got to juice that and then it's 
got to be heated to concentrate it and then it's

got to be crystallized down but just in a moment 
on the crafting table we can do all that process

get rid of all the equipment so there's a fair few 
leaps of faith in this game. So we have the two

piles of sugar fortunately i don't have to process 
that from the sugar cane. We could also look at it

a different way and say well each square block in 
minecraft is one meter by one meter so one meter

squared one. Meter squared of sugarcane will 
usually yield about a kilo of sugar so there's

quite a bit of variation there obviously we have 
two piles of sugar and with those calculations we

can go anywhere between 800 grams and two kilos 
of sugar depending on how much you want to use

in your cake recipe so we've got a bit of wiggle 
room there which is good. Then moving on to the

eggs eggs is probably the easiest a chicken will 
usually lay one egg a day if it's a laying hen

and one egg is one egg so i guess that's all we've 
got to work with. Compared to the magnitude of the

other ingredients really does seem like a small 
amount and then next of course we have the wheat

one metre squared of organically grown wheat 
well you don't spray pesticides in minecraft

so i'm assuming it's organically grown if you had 
pesticides you'd get more per meter squared but

let's go for organically grown ... that will give 
you approximately 550 grams of your wheat grains

and we have three bunches of wheat so that means 
we have 1650 grams of wheat grains to work with.

Now that we have the ingredients list sorted 
with two piles of sugar 1650 grams of wheat one

lonesome egg and three three and a half litre 
buckets of milk. Now that's a lot of milk it's

ten and a half liters all together and that's the 
first thing people question about this recipe how

can you possibly make a cake using that much milk? 
And we'll get to that in a minute but first of all

i want to start with the wheat. We obviously need 
to grind it up and there must be a lot of hidden

equipment in minecraft that we don't see and 
then we need to sift the wheat ... I just want

the white part of the flour because it'll be way 
too dense to use a full wholemeal flour for a cake

so i'm going to waste a lot of the grain here. 
Now back to the milk now the milk that you buy

in shops is homogenized and what that means is all 
of the little fat particles are processed to make

them smaller and all the same size homo meaning 
the same and so homogenized you're making it all

the same size and what that does by making them 
smaller than same size is it means they stay mixed

into the milk. So back in the olden days if you 
had milk delivered that was fresh milk the cream

would float to the top nowadays that cream stays 
mixed all the way through because the milk is

homogenized. So you don't get one person getting 
all the cream and everyone else basically getting

skim milk from the underneath. So if you freshly 
milk a cow like we did in minecraft and then you

left that milk in the refrigerator overnight do 
they have refrigerators in minecraft? Then that

cream is going to slowly rise to the top and we 
can scoop off that cream which is going to give us

the fat that we need to make our cake so we don't 
need all the skim milk but we do need that amount

of milk to get the amount of cream we need to make 
the cake. Here we go attempt number one i'm going

to use two cups of the flour keep the rest for 
the frosting as i said, most of one pile of sugar

and some milk. Then i think i'll separate the egg 
and put the yolk in with the flour and mix that in

it's really really dry that's because it's quite 
like still wholemeal even though we've left a lot

of the whole meal out it's not acting like a 
normal plain flour so we're gonna have to add

a bit more milk in there and then to add some 
air i'm gonna need to whisk the egg white and

whisk the cream as well. There's no baking powder 
in this recipe so we've got no way of adding air

normally when you add baking powder it makes the 
bubbles and that's what makes your cake rise so

we can't do that using baking powder so i'm going 
to have to try and add air using the egg white and

whipping the cream but the only problem is we've 
only got one egg white so this is a really dense

solid cake mixture that we're getting here. Fold 
in the egg white and the cream and that is just

way too dense it's not aerating at all but never 
mind, let's tip that into a cake pan and spread

it out and into the oven it goes. Now Jedd pointed 
out to me that in the game they use the crafting

table only it doesn't get baked in the furnace 
so in that case we'd have raw cake batter but

i'm going to bake this so that we can taste it 
safely. It did rise a tiny bit but not much.

Now for the frosting i'm using some milk we 
have plenty of that and the rest of the flour

and the rest of the sugar and the remainder of 
the cream. So we've made it using everything

on the ingredients list in the proportions 
they gave us except for that leftover skim

milk and the leftover husks from the wheat. So 
now we're going to heat that up and whisk it

and continue to heat it until it starts 
to bubble so that all that flour cooks

and then you just leave that to cool and once it's 
room temperature you can whip it up and this makes

a frosting, it's a bit like an ermine frosting 
but modified to suit the minecraft ingredients.

So how does the cake look once it's baked well 
it's pretty flat and it feels well pretty solid.

Let's cut it open that is solid there's no 
spring to it at all the texture is classic of

a few things. If you're trying to troubleshoot 
a cake recipe in my cookbook each chapter has

a food science introduction and the chapter on 
cakes would be helpful for this particular cake.

Because what I did is I got the exact same cupcake 
recipe and I baked 30 different batches of it

with slight variations on different ingredients 
changing one ingredient at a time so that you

could see the difference that changing for example 
decreasing the sugar what effect will that have on

the cake. All the different variations you can 
think of I baked them all separately so I could

cut the cupcakes open, take photos so you can 
visually see what difference that's going to have.

Thank you to everyone who has already pre-ordered 
my cookbook one of the weekends it hit number 10

in ALL books in the US on best sellers on amazon 
and I was just like what! You guys are just crazy

you really have shown so much support and so much 
love for the channel and I just want to say thank

you so much for that 💕 and a lot of people have 
asked can we get the book signed? Obviously I

can't travel because there's a travel ban out 
of Australia and into Australia with Covid,

hopefully eventually it all gets under control and 
we can all move around again but for the moment

what I have done is I have done some signed book 
plates I've signed some holographic stickers and

I've hand signed those. Now I couldn't get them 
sent out with the books themselves because we're

distributing all over the world some distributors 
could do it some couldn't and I didn't want it

to be unfair to anyone. So what I decided to do 
instead when I hit a roadblock with that was to

do signed bookplate stickers for any patrons that 
pre-order the book. So if you are a patron of How

To Cook That and you've pre-ordered make sure you 
check the patreon page and fill out the form to

get yourself a free holographic signed book plate 
they are limited edition that's the only way you

can get those and thank you again for pre-ordering 
my book! Oh my gosh I'm so excited to get a copy I

don't even have a copy yet they're sending me 
an advanced run copy and it hasn't arrived as

soon as it does i will be opening it on camera 
to show you it's just going to be amazing to

actually see it finally in print bound in a book. 
Very exciting! Okay back to the minecraft cake so

let's have attempt number two i've got the cream 
from the three buckets of milk, flour and i'm

using store-bought flour this time simply because 
i can't be bothered grinding the weight again,

two piles of sugar and an egg now i am going to 
make some adjustments to the recipe this time

we need baking powder. Now sodium bicarbonate 
can be made chemically or it can be mined from

trona so that's something they could add into the 
minecraft game if they didn't want you to make

that sort of leap of faith you also need it for 
making glass but the glass recipe at the moment

is just sand makes glass so they could add it in 
but if they add everything it's going to get a

bit too complicated so we'll just assume this one 
was supposed to be in there and they just didn't

want to add those tiny details. One change that 
does need to happen though is we're going to need

three eggs instead of one. There's just not enough 
protein in there compared to the volume of flour

and everything else we have to hold the structure 
of this cake. Let's put some of that cream into

the mixer i'll keep some of it to use for the 
frosting then add in the sugar and all three eggs

and now i'm going to whisk that on high speed 
until we get a thick frothy emulsion so it's

nice and airy. Then i'm going to add in the 
flour and the baking powder and i'm sifting

that in to add as much air as possible and then 
we're going to mix that till it's just combined.

Then tip that into the same size cake tin as we 
used for the last one and bake it in the oven and

look at that it is rising up and you can tell 
already that it's going to be a fluffier cake.

Fresh out of the oven and you can see it has quite 
a bit more spring to it we'll leave that to cool

and then we'll decorate it. For the frosting on 
this one i'm just going to whip the leftover cream

and then added in a thick layer on the top of the 
cake to square it up. Now the cake in Minecraft

is quite different it's one meter by one meter 
squared for one and there's no way we can make

a cake that big with these ingredients but for 
two it's got those red bits on top of the cake

and there was nothing red in the ingredients 
list so what should we use for the red bits?

I guess there are berries it's not raspberries but 
it's berries but let's just make that raspberries

for today and we'll just add some raspberries on 
top of our cake so that it looks a bit more like

the minecraft cake. This is gonna need a taste 
test the one on your right was made using the

proportion of ingredients they used to make the 
cake in minecraft so give that one a try first...

It's ... it's all right it's 
definitely cake like it's passable

but it's very stodgy and it reminds me of like 
breadcrust. It's like it's like rough and it's not

nice and fluffy it's really dense. The 
other one has the same ingredients but

with a couple of extra eggs and some baking 
powder let me know what you think of that one?

It's fluffy the cream's 
good and I love raspberries.

Much fluffier and sweeter I think I definitely 
like this one better than the other one. So there

you have it slightly adjusting the recipe makes 
it heaps better but all the recipes in Minecraft

are not really exact and they tend to be missing 
a few of the things you'd actually need so I don't

think it's meant to be followed as is but it was 
a fun challenge thank you so much for that. Thanks

so much to all my patrons for your support 
don't forget to go get your signed bookplate

and I'll put a link here to where you can 
go and get my cookbook you can pre-order

it there's a list of booksellers there. If 
you enjoyed this video make sure you let the

algorithm know you did so by liking subscribing 
commenting watching more of my videos and turn

on the notification bell you've got to go 
in and click all notifications as well or

it doesn't work thanks youtube make it a 
great week and we'll see you on Friday ❤️
